alert.note: Alert for Morris; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 13 at 8:30PM EDT until March 14 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches, mainly over the higher elevations. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Warren and Morris. * WHEN...Until 6 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain will change to snow later tonight into Tuesday morning. The transition will take longer at lower elevations. The greatest snow totals will be in the higher elevations mainly above 1000 feet. Southern and southeast portions of Warren and Morris Counties may not even reach an inch of snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
